org.catechis.dto
Class WordLastTestDates

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.dto.WordLastTestDates

public class WordLastTestDates
extends java.lang.Object

This class stores a hash of Word objects using a test date as a key. It can return a sorted list of these words. It is up to the calling code to determine what type (reading/writing) of words are added, etc.

Constructor Detail

WordLastTestDates

public WordLastTestDates()
Method Detail

addWord

public void addWord(Word word,
                    java.lang.String last_test_date)

Add the word using the passed in date turned into milliseconds as the key.

If the key already exists in the list because many words were tested in the same group of ten for instance, then we add one to the milliseconds to differentiate it. We do this recursively until we find a new unused key.

We must:

know the type, reading or writing to use the exclude level times

times each day by the static day member.

If type is null then we add the word as-is. Otherwise we exlude the word if it is in the exclude time period.

For instance, if the standard value for level zero exclude date is set to one, and the type is set to reading, and thew word is at reading level zero and has been tested in the last 24 hours, then that word is skipped.

If the limit of words value is set, no more words are added after the initial check. // got exclude value for that date // exclude value times 86400000 milliseconds in a day // get currant time // minus the exclude time // if the word being passed in has a key in this period // do nothing to exclude this word // add it to the list

addWordOrExclude

public void addWordOrExclude(Word word,
                             java.lang.String last_test_date)

Same as addWord except that this method checks the words last test date to see if it is within the exclude level period, in which case it will not be included in the list.

Add the word using the passed in date turned into milliseconds as the key.

If the key already exists in the list because many words were tested in the same group of ten for instance, then we add one to the milliseconds to differentiate it. We do this recursively until we find a new unused key.

We must:

know the type, reading or writing to use the exclude level times

times each day by the static day member.

If type is null then we add the word as-is. Otherwise we exlude the word if it is in the exclude time period. This happens in the setWord method)

For instance, if the standard value for level zero exclude date is set to one, and the type is set to reading, and thew word is at reading level zero and has been tested in the last 24 hours, then that word is skipped.

If the limit of words value is set, no more words are added after the initial check. // got exclude value for that date // exclude value times 86400000 milliseconds in a day // get currant time // minus the exclude time // if the word being passed in has a key in this period // do nothing to exclude this word // add it to the list

Apply the exclude level time vector to find out if the word should be added to the list or not.

Hashtable ltd_hash, Vector elt_vector, String type, int limit_of_words;

public java.util.ArrayList getSortedWLTDKeys()

getUniqueKey

private java.lang.Long getUniqueKey(long milliseconds)
If there is already a key with the exact same time, add 1 millisecond until the key is unique.

This is needed because when words are imported, they all get the same date of entry.

getUniqueFile

private java.lang.String getUniqueFile(long milliseconds,
                                       java.lang.String folder)
Same as getUniqueKey except instead of keys the files in the /vocab/lists/wltd/ folder there are files named after the milliseconds.

removeWord

public void removeWord(java.lang.Long key_to_remove)
Not sure if we should also remove the key. Right now I think that it doesnt hurt to leave that list alone, and when the list is empty, the user can get a new list. Currently the key is removed in the Struts Action

getList

public int getList(java.util.Vector all_word_categories,
                   Storage store,
                   java.lang.String user_name)
This utility method takes a list of categories and a Storage object and returns an interger of total words found in all the categories. Passing in the categories which can be obtained themselves from the store lets the calling methods set up their own categories. Its used in a test like this: Vector all_word_categories = store.getWordCategories("exclusive", user_name); int expected_words = wltd.getList(all_word_categories, store, user_name);

getWaitingTests

public java.util.Vector getWaitingTests(java.lang.String user_id,

Returns the file names in the wntd folder.

updateTestDateRecords

public void updateTestDateRecords(java.lang.String user_id,
                                  java.lang.String current_dir,
                                  WordTestResult wtr)
Erase the old last test date file and create a new file with the current date and then erase the old next test date file and create a new file for the next test date.

The next_test_date argument represents the a test that was just run, so at this point it is the last_test_date, so the last_test_date should be set in the word from the action and this becomes the name of the new wltd/time.xml file, and the current time plus the time till the next test date becomes the new file in wntd/next_time.xml.

We also need to back up the erased files and store references to the new files for a potential undo, as well as record links to the new test dates to erase them in such a case.

updateTestDateRecordsAndReturnMemory

public TestTimeMemory updateTestDateRecordsAndReturnMemory(java.lang.String user_id,
                                                           java.lang.String current_dir,
                                                           WordTestResult wtr)
Same as updateTestDateRecords but returns a TestTimeMemory object.

This object has the following members: original_wltd; new_wltd; original_wntd; new_wntd; type;

createLists

public void createLists(java.util.Vector all_word_categories,
                        Storage store,
                        java.lang.String user_name)
This utility creates a file named after the words last test date (type specific) which contains the word id and the words category file name.

the return argument is stored in the wntd file so that both files can be changed later.

This method caused a lot of problems for us. We created the whole quaquaverse 0.4/0.5 app just to trak down all our problems to this spot.

createNewLists

public void createNewLists(java.util.Vector all_word_categories,
                           Storage store,
                           java.lang.String user_name)
Based on createLists but uses longs instead of strings for the dates. This utility creates a file named after the words last test date (type specific) which contains the word id and the words category file name.

the return argument is stored in the wntd file so that both files can be changed later.

This method caused a lot of problems for us. We created the whole quaquaverse 0.4/0.5 app just to trak down all our problems to this spot.

createNewWordList

public void createNewWordList(Word word,
                              Storage store,
                              java.lang.String user_id,
                              java.lang.String current_dir)
This method assumes the word entered has no tests, and so its first test date will be calculated by its date of entry.

The reading test should be before the writing test, based on the value in the elt vecotr for level 0 words.

getAdjustedList

public int getAdjustedList(java.util.Vector all_word_categories,
                           Storage store,
                           java.lang.String user_name)
This utility method is like getList, except it uses the ExcludeWord object to reject words that have been tested recently. This is used when the list of words is to be tested, and not a study list.
